main event: A witness reported observing a shiny white light object that appeared to be moving and then disappeared behind a cloud in Bedford, Ohio on June 3, 1965.
interesting points: The object was as bright as the sun and appeared to be moving, but the apparent motion was likely due to the movement of the clouds.
The object was visible for about 4.5 minutes.
The witness was able to observe the object without the use of binoculars or other optical aids.
The witness reported that the object appeared to be rotating or moving back and forth, and emitted no sound or visible exhaust/flame.
The witness asked if the sighting had been reported by any other observers in the area and if the office had received any other similar reports.
